newsitem.title: UK: Sugar freight activity thin ahead of holiday break.
newsitem.headline: Sugar freight activity thin ahead of holiday break.

text.p: Activity was subdued on the sugar freight market at the end of the week, with only one new order emerging as London-based players took advantage of the long holiday weekend, shipbrokers said on Friday.
"Everyone's winding down, a lot of people are off today. It is very quiet," said one shipbroker.
The only fresh inquiry quoted on Friday came from U.S. operator Garnac, which quoted for 12/12,600 tonnes of bagged sugar from Santos to Callao for prompt dates.
Shipbrokers said no fixtures had been reported.
